Package com.company

Class ClientHandler

java.lang.Object
com.company.ClientHandler
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
public class ClientHandler
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
Client Handler class is a Runnable (for multithreading) that allows a server application to manage communication with a client application. This will handle setting up input and output streams as well as setting up a name, ip, and port for the connected client.

  • Constructor Details

    • ClientHandler

      public ClientHandler​(java.net.Socket s, java.lang.String user, java.lang.String ipAddress, int port, java.io.DataInputStream dis, java.io.DataOutputStream dos)
      ClientHandler Constructor. Creates state for initial communication between a specific client and server.
      Parameters:
      s - Socket Connection for the Client and Server
      user - Name of the User running at this client
      ipAddress - IP address of connected client
      port - Port the Client software is running on for the client
      dis - Input Stream
      dos - Output Stream

  • Method Details

    • writeOutput

      public void writeOutput()
      Prints Name, Address, and Port of a Client to the Terminal.

    • run

      public void run()
      Run method for use in multi threaded application. This will Recieve a message from a connected client. It will then tokenize the message to determine the message, recipient address, and recipient port. It will then loop through all available clients in the Server AR vector to find the specified client and send the message to them. If the message "logout" is detected connection to the input and output streams for them will be closed. Also sets status for that client to isloggedin to false.
      Specified by:
      run in interface java.lang.Runnable
